Comment: lɔlɔ=to say, to tell, liara=to answer
teri=cut by hacking, e.g. bones; sei= cut by sawing, e.g. bread
detizuri=to drop; also applies when we shoot but miss the target
lɔgɔ=to lie (polite) (can be used for women), buri=to lie (impolite) can be used for men.
isi=be at (e.g. person in village, coffee in glas, pulsa in phone)
teɁine=suck smoke from sigaret, ge= suck milk from breast
bura=buy and sell; gini=to do, to carry out
tiabuna=wait for something that is not yet sure; gutubuna=wait for something/someone that is sure to come; ani wutubuna=wait for me
both used for male and female
both used for male and female
no difference in politeness or meaning
ale ama = wet rice field, teli ama = corn field
lebeke=flat, even (e.g. pile of sand that is flattened/made even); nifihi=thin
